alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 2:49PM EDT until April 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from dams. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, 5600 - cfs - Waterfront park areas near the M-69 bridge and low lying areas along the river in Crystal Falls become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:10 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 7.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 05/09/1979. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 715 AM EDT /615 AM CDT/.
